lines.text: Miss Laszlo watches all the old pictures, and a lot of the actors have passed away.
I saw a marvelous comedy last night. The entire cast was dead.
A bachelor's conscience is a woman's best friend.
The only nice thing you can say about men is they're all the same.
Harry, I've had martinis all over the world... and I can safely say... yours are the worst.

[to Carol]
But there's an opening in merchandise, and you have character, integrity, and principle. It'd be interesting to see if an executive could survivewith such handicaps.

[as she punches out]
No, it's, uh, just that I haven't had my tetanus shot.

[about her fiance Lester]
I'm 33, and he's the last gas station before I hit the desert.
Miss Corman, good-bye. They say that a man forgets pain and remembers pleasure. My memory of you will be a complete blank.
